column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Singleton agents yarded 544 cattle, with the majority maintaining good quality. However, the offering included some lighter, secondary-type cattle with teeth. A major processor resumed operations after a lengthy hiatus.
 
Weaner steers back to the paddock 15c to 36c/kg better off selling from 300c to 458c/kg. A big jump of 55c/kg for heavier types over 330kg making from 338c to 414c/kg. Grain assisted B muscle steers to the trade made to 380c/kg weighing 435kg. Re-stocker weaner heifers up to 28c/kg dearer and traded between 310c and 356c/kg.
 
Heavy feeder yearling steers over 400kg were 26c to 34c/kg dearer selling from 346c to 394c/kg. Not many yearling heifers to quote and they traded from 280c to 358c/kg.
 
Heavy grown steers to process sold from 326c to 366c/kg and heifers 301c to 362c/kg. The few 2 score cows to re-stockers saw a remarkable rise making from 275c to 294c/kg whilst the heavy prime 3 and 4 scores jumped 10c to 23c/kg trading from 300c to 330c/kg.
 
Market Operator Angus Barlow.
